children.text: There are joins in the bottom plates that have not been supported by a joist or solid blocking.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 1684 Residential Timber-Framed Construction, clause 6.2.2.2 Bottom Plates states
‘Bottom plates may be butt-jointed provided both ends are fixed and supported by floor joists, solid blocking or a concrete slab’ .
This bottom plate join must be properly supported to comply with the above standard.
